results.adx_keywords: Football;damar hamlin;Buffalo Bills;Cincinnati Bengals
results.byline: By Emmanuel Morgan and Ken Belson
results.title: Damar Hamlin of Buffalo Bills in Critical Condition After Collapsing During N.F.L. Game
results.abstract: Hamlin, a 24-year-old safety, suffered cardiac arrest after being hit, but his heartbeat was restored by medical personnel, the Bills said. The game against the Cincinnati Bengals was postponed.

media.caption: An ambulance carrying Damar Hamlin left the field at Paycor Stadium during the game between the Bills and Bengals on Monday night.

results.adx_keywords: Snow and Snowstorms;Sheriffs;Actors and Actresses;Weather;Renner, Jeremy;Lake Tahoe (Nev)
results.byline: By Jenny Gross
results.title: Jeremy Renner Is in Critical Condition After Snow Plowing Accident
results.abstract: The actor, known for his role as Hawkeye in Marvel’s Avengers movies, had surgery, his representative said.

media.caption: Jeremy Renner plays the superhero Hawkeye in Marvel movies and a television series.

results.adx_keywords: Colleges and Universities;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Forensic Science;Chapin, Ethan (d 2022);Goncalves, Kaylee (d 2022);Kernodle, Xana (d 2022);Kohberger, Bryan C;Mogen, Madison (d 2022);University of Idaho;Washington State University;Idaho;Moscow (Idaho)
results.byline: By Nicholas Bogel-Burroughs, Rachel Sun, Mike Baker and Serge F. Kovaleski
results.title: Idaho Murder Suspect Had Been a Student of the Criminal Mind
results.abstract: The arrest of a graduate student in the murder of four University of Idaho students eased fears but raised a troubling new question: What was the motive?

media.caption: The home where four University of Idaho students were found dead on Nov. 13 in Moscow, Idaho.

results.adx_keywords: Frauds and Swindling;United States Politics and Government;Content Type: Personal Profile;Santos, George (1988- );House of Representatives;Brazil
results.byline: By Grace Ashford and André Spigariol
results.title: Brazilian Authorities Will Revive Fraud Case Against George Santos
results.abstract: A 2008 court case had been suspended because Brazilian law enforcement officials could not find Mr. Santos.

media.caption: Although George Santos had once admitted to using a stolen checkbook in Brazil, he now asserts that he is not a criminal “here or in Brazil.”

results.adx_keywords: Firearms;Gun Control;Atlanta (Ga);Georgia
results.byline: By Richard Fausset
results.title: A Heavily Armed Man Caused Panic at a Supermarket. But Did He Break the Law?
results.abstract: In states with permissive gun laws, police and prosecutors have limited tools at their disposal when a heavily armed individual sows fear or panic in public.

media.caption: A Publix at an outdoor shopping mall in Atlanta, where an armed man entered the store and was arrested.

results.adx_keywords: Height (Stature);Global Warming;Children and Childhood;Human Growth Hormone;Dating and Relationships;internal-sub-only
results.byline: By Mara Altman
results.title: There Has Never Been a Better Time to Be Short
results.abstract: Short people don’t just save resources; as resources become scarcer owing to overpopulation and global warming, they may also be best suited for long-term survival.

media.copyright: Illustration by Sam Whitney/The New York Times; images by Man_Half-tube, via Getty Images

results.adx_keywords: vis-photo;International Relations;Politics and Government;Hinduism;Coronavirus (2019-nCoV);Russian Invasion of Ukraine (2022);International Trade and World Market;Nationalism (Theory and Philosophy);Economic Conditions and Trends;Religion and Belief;Muslims and Islam;Group of Twenty;Ganges River;Varanasi (India);Chennai (India);New Delhi (India);India
results.byline: By Roger Cohen and Mauricio Lima
results.title: Russia’s War Could Make It India’s World
results.abstract: The invasion of Ukraine, compounding the effects of the pandemic, has contributed to the ascent of a giant that defies easy alignment. It could be the decisive force in a changing global system.

media.caption: A Hindu ritual on the banks of the Ganges River in Varanasi, northern India. Prime Minister Narendra Modi has chosen Varanasi as a core vehicle of his assertion of India as a Hindu nation, raising tensions with Muslims.
media.copyright: Mauricio Lima for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Ethics and Official Misconduct;United States Politics and Government;Santos, George (1988- );LaLota, Nicholas;House of Representatives;Republican Party;Brazil
results.byline: By Michael Gold and Grace Ashford
results.title: As His Life of Fantasy Comes Into Focus, George Santos Goes to Washington
results.abstract: Mr. Santos, under scrutiny for lies about his background, is set to be sworn into Congress on Tuesday even as records, colleagues and friends divulge more about his past.

media.caption: More details about George Santos’s deceptions have been unearthed before he is set to be sworn into Congress on Tuesday.
media.copyright: Mikayla Whitmore for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Hospitals;Sex Crimes;Nursing and Nurses;Video Recordings, Downloads and Streaming;Suits and Litigation (Civil);Lambros, Christopher P;Intermountain Healthcare;Grand Junction (Colo)
results.byline: By Michael Levenson and McKenna Oxenden
results.title: Ex-Nurse Recorded Himself Sexually Assaulting Patients, Police Say
results.abstract: Christopher P. Lambros, 61, was charged with sexual assault after recording videos of himself assaulting unconscious female patients at a Colorado hospital, officials said.

media.caption: Christopher P. Lambros, who worked for 10 years at St. Mary’s Medical Center in Grand Junction, Colo., was fired after his arrest in October.
media.copyright: Gretel Daugherty/Grand Junction Daily Sentinel, via Associated Press

results.adx_keywords: Elections, House of Representatives;McCarthy, Kevin (1965- );Republican Party;House of Representatives
results.byline: By Brendan Buck
results.title: A Failed Speaker Vote for Kevin McCarthy Would Be a Historic Event
results.abstract: A small group of Republicans has promised to vote against Kevin McCarthy this week. They could throw the House into chaos not seen for a century.

media.copyright: Mark Peterson for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Water Pollution;Sewers and Sewage;Algae;Coastal Areas;Global Warming;Cape Cod (Mass)
results.byline: By Christopher Flavelle and Sophie Park
results.title: A Toxic Stew on Cape Cod: Human Waste and Warming Water
results.abstract: Climate change is contributing to electric-green algae blooms. Massachusetts wants a cleanup of the antiquated septic systems feeding the mess, but it could cost billions.

media.caption: Ashley Fisher, director of the Mashpee Department of Natural Resources in Massachusetts, took samples from the bed of the Mashpee River earlier this month.

results.adx_keywords: Funerals and Memorials;Prayers and Prayer Books;Benedict XVI;Roman Catholic Church;Vatican City
results.byline: By Emma Bubola and Elisabetta Povoledo
results.title: ‘I Hold Him in My Heart’: Tens of Thousands Pay Respects to Benedict
results.abstract: The pope emeritus is lying in state in St. Peter’s Basilica, where some 65,000 mourners, including Roman Catholic faithful and tourists, had paid last respects by Monday evening.

results.adx_keywords: Curfews;Murders, Attempted Murders and Homicides;Crime and Criminals;Eudora (Ark)
results.byline: By Rick Rojas
results.title: In a Small Arkansas City, Crime, Dread and an Emergency Curfew
results.abstract: A gun death on Christmas Eve crystallized the fear and frustration over violence that had been building in Eudora, Ark., a city of 1,700, for months.

media.copyright: Rory Doyle for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Coyotes;Dogs;Pets;Massachusetts;Nahant (Mass);Boston (Mass)
results.byline: By Jenna Russell
results.title: A New England Town Invaded by Coyotes Calls in the Sharpshooters
results.abstract: Compact, densely populated and surrounded by water, Nahant (and its small dogs) are on edge. It’s the first Massachusetts municipality to ask the government to kill problem animals.

media.caption: Marginal Road, a coyote hot spot in Nahant, Mass.
media.copyright: Sophie Park for The New York Times

results.byline: By Nicholas Confessore
results.title: The Invention of Elise Stefanik
results.abstract: To rise through the Trump-era G.O.P., a young congresswoman gave up her friends, her mentors and her ideals. Will it be enough?

results.byline: By Jack Nicas and André Spigariol
results.title: Lula Becomes Brazil’s President, With Bolsonaro in Florida
results.abstract: Brazil inaugurates its new president, Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva, on Sunday. Facing investigations, former President Jair Bolsonaro has taken refuge in Orlando.

media.caption: President Luis Inacio Lula da Silva , First Lady Rosangela Lula da Silva, Vice president Geraldo Alckmin and his wife Maria Lucia Alckmin riding an open car after being sworn in at the Congress in Brasilia , Brazil, on Sunday.

results.byline: By Christine Chung
results.title: Jeremiah Green, Drummer for Modest Mouse, Dies at 45
results.abstract: Mr. Green was one of the founding members of Modest Mouse, an indie rock band founded in Washington State in the 1990s that was known for its textured and wide-ranging sound.

media.caption: Jeremiah Green performing at the Audacy Beach Festival at Fort Lauderdale Beach Park in Florida in 2021.

results.adx_keywords: Exercise;Alcoholic Beverages;Habits and Routines (Behavior)
results.byline: By Gretchen Reynolds
results.title: How Exercise May Affect Our Alcohol Consumption
results.abstract: People who are aerobically fit and work out a lot tend to imbibe more than their less fit peers.

media.copyright: Elizabeth Weinberg for The New York Times

results.adx_keywords: Human Trafficking;Sex Crimes;Women and Girls;Social Media;Tate, Andrew (1986- );Romania;Bucharest (Romania)
results.byline: By McKenna Oxenden and Jenny Gross
results.title: Andrew Tate Is Charged With Human Trafficking and Rape in Romania
results.abstract: Mr. Tate, an online personality known for making misogynistic comments, and three others will be held in custody for 30 days, the authorities said.

media.caption: Andrew Tate was escorted outside the headquarters of the Directorate for the Investigation of Organized Crime and Terrorism in Bucharest, Romania, on Thursday.
